member.name: T:Google.GData.Extensions.WebContentLink
member.summary: Models a special kind of Atom link that contains a WebContent element.

member.name: F:Google.GData.Extensions.WebContentLink.WEB_CONTENT_REL
member.summary: defines the webcontent rel value for the atom:link

member.name: M:Google.GData.Extensions.WebContentLink.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new Atom link containing a WebContent extension and with the appropriate rel attribute.

member.name: M:Google.GData.Extensions.WebContentLink.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs a new Atom link containing a WebContent extension and with the appropriate rel attribute. This constructor lets you specify if you want the extension element to be created for you. The parser sets this to false as it refuses to override pre-existing elements (even empty ones.)
member.param: Optionally create the web content extension.

member.name: P:Google.GData.Extensions.WebContentLink.Icon
member.summary: The icon URL for the WebContent entry is really just the HRef of the link itself.

member.name: P:Google.GData.Extensions.WebContentLink.Height
member.summary: Alias for the Height property of the nested WebContent element.

member.name: P:Google.GData.Extensions.WebContentLink.Width
member.summary: Alias for the Width property of the nested WebContent element.

member.name: P:Google.GData.Extensions.WebContentLink.GadgetPreferences
member.summary: Alias for the GadgetPreferences property of the nested WebContent element.

member.name: P:Google.GData.Extensions.WebContentLink.Url
member.summary: The Url property just references the Url of the nested WebContent element

member.name: P:Google.GData.Extensions.WebContentLink.WebContent
member.summary: Property that lets one modify the associated WebContent entry directly.

member.name: T:Google.GData.Calendar.EventQuery
member.summary: A subclass of FeedQuery, to create a Calendar query URI. Provides public properties that describe the different aspects of the URI, as well as a composite URI.

member.name: M:Google.GData.Calendar.EventQuery.#ctor
member.summary: base constructor

member.name: M:Google.GData.Calendar.EventQuery.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: base constructor, with initial queryUri
member.param: the query to use

member.name: M:Google.GData.Calendar.EventQuery.ParseUri(System.Uri)
member.summary: protected void ParseUri
member.param: takes an incoming Uri string and parses all the properties out of it
member.returns: throws a query exception when it finds something wrong with the input, otherwise returns a baseuri

member.name: M:Google.GData.Calendar.EventQuery.Reset
member.summary: Resets object state to default, as if newly created.

member.name: M:Google.GData.Calendar.EventQuery.CalculateQuery(System.String)
member.summary: Creates the partial URI query string based on all set properties.
member.returns: string => the query part of the URI

member.name: P:Google.GData.Calendar.EventQuery.TimeZone
member.summary: this indicates the ctz parameter in the query. It allows you specify the timezone that is used to calculate the start/end times for events

member.name: P:Google.GData.Calendar.EventQuery.SortOrder
member.summary: indicates the sortorder of the returned feed

member.name: P:Google.GData.Calendar.EventQuery.SingleEvents
member.summary: Decides wether recurring events should be expanded or not

member.name: P:Google.GData.Calendar.EventQuery.FutureEvents
member.summary: Decides wether events in the past should be returned. Defa

member.name: P:Google.GData.Calendar.EventQuery.StartTime
member.summary: StartTime, this effects the start-min parameter of the uri Together with start-max creates a timespan such that only events that are within the timespan are returned. If not specified, default start-min is 1970-01-01.

member.name: P:Google.GData.Calendar.EventQuery.EndTime
member.summary: EndTime, this effects the start-max parameter of the uri Together with start-min creates a timespan such that only events that are within the timespan are returned. If not specified, default start-max is 2031-01-01.

member.name: P:Google.GData.Calendar.EventQuery.RecurrenceStart
member.summary: RecurrenceStart, effects the recurrance-expansion-start parameter Specifies beginning of time period for which to expand recurring events.

member.name: P:Google.GData.Calendar.EventQuery.RecurrenceEnd
member.summary: RecurrenceEnd, effects the recurrance-expansion-end parameter Specifies ending of time period for which to expand recurring events.
